commit_list.message:
Fix broken module namespacing in ActiveResource with Ruby 1.9 [#5699 state:resolved]

Following namespace use case was broken with Ruby 1.9:

  class Author < ActiveRecord::Base
    ...
  end

  module Api
    class Book < ActiveResouce::Base
    end
  end

Let's say XML contains <book><author><name>John</name></author>....

  Api::Book.first.author.class.to_s #=>
    Ruby 1.8.7: "Api::Book::Author" (namespaced, correct),
    Ruby 1.9: "Author" (toplevel, broken)

Signed-off-by: José Valim <jose.valim@gmail.com>

Made the post body available to the routing when testing a request.

When using request helpers like post(), put() or request() the set :post_body will also be available to the routing.
This mean you can write specs that test the deffered routing behaviour in your app,
when the behaviour relies on request.raw_post.

Signed-off-by: Michael S. Klishin <michael@novemberain.com>

commit_list.message:
You can now use request_to with a post body:

e.g. request_to("/", :post, {:post_body => 'deferred'})
In r.match('/').defer_to { |request, params| }, request.raw_post will equal 'deferred'.
Useful for testing complex routes.

Signed-off-by: Michael S. Klishin <michael@novemberain.com>

Workaround for XDomainRequest bug in Internet Explorer 9.

Internet Explorer 9 will abort requests when the 'onprogress' event of the XDomainRequest object is not handled.
Therefore added empty event handler.

commit_list.message:
Catch "Stream not writable" errors, thrown when a socket connection is closed during WebSocket handshake. This is probably caused by a user behind a proxy, breaking WebSocket connections.
TODO browser should switch to a more reliable transport when WebSocket handshake fails.

commit_list.message:
Respect X-Forwarded-Proto HTTP header when dealing with the WebSocket handshake.

When using a reverse proxy to do the SSL heavy lifting, the proxy will talk plain http to Faye.
In order to return the correct WebSocket-Location, Faye needs to know if the original request (between browser and proxy) was secure or not.

commit_list.message: Use wss: scheme when connection is secure.

commit_list.message:
Made the post body available to the routing when testing a request.

When using request helpers like post(), put() or request() the set :post_body will also be available to the routing.
This mean you can write specs that test the deffered routing behaviour in your app,
when the behaviour relies on request.raw_post.

Signed-off-by: Michael S. Klishin <michael@novemberain.com>

commit_list.message:
You can now use request_to with a post body:

e.g. request_to("/", :post, {:post_body => 'deferred'})
In r.match('/').defer_to { |request, params| }, request.raw_post will equal 'deferred'.
Useful for testing complex routes.

Signed-off-by: Michael S. Klishin <michael@novemberain.com>

Fix broken module namespacing in ActiveResource with Ruby 1.9 [#5699 state:resolved]

Following namespace use case was broken with Ruby 1.9:

  class Author < ActiveRecord::Base
    ...
  end

  module Api
    class Book < ActiveResouce::Base
    end
  end

Let's say XML contains <book><author><name>John</name></author>....

  Api::Book.first.author.class.to_s #=>
    Ruby 1.8.7: "Api::Book::Author" (namespaced, correct),
    Ruby 1.9: "Author" (toplevel, broken)

Signed-off-by: José Valim <jose.valim@gmail.com>

commit_list.message:
Rewind to beginning of file before reading from it.

Fixes an issue with Paperclip calling TempFile.read internally just before flushing writes,
resulting in s3_paperclib.rb uploading an empty file.
See http://github.com/thoughtbot/paperclip/commit/2cdeb39a514242df2fdc8a75e193dcecde5a74d5

[CLIENT] Fixed, that `ServerError` inherits from `Transport::Error`

Allow rescuing raised Errors::NotFound or Errors::ServerError by rescue
Transport::Error.

Behavior is now in line with documentation: “The highest-level
exception is {Elasticsearch::Transport::Transport::Error} and will be
raised for any generic client or server errors.”

Closes #100

commit_list.message:
Move each metric into a separate class.

Instead of the Rack Middleware performing monitoring tasks,
it simply calls Metric.all

A metric is a class that defines a `monitor` method. This
method has the opportunity to fetch statistics and call the
`error(msg)` method to report any problems.

Configuration values are now know to `Metric.config` instead of
the Rack Middleware.

commit_list.message:
Monitor failure percentage

GET /queue-status returns 503 service unavailable when more than 10%
of today's jobs have failed. Threshold is configurable by setting
config.queue_failure_rate.

commit_list.message:
Fix broken module namespacing in ActiveResource with Ruby 1.9 [#5699 state:resolved]

Following namespace use case was broken with Ruby 1.9:

  class Author < ActiveRecord::Base
    ...
  end

  module Api
    class Book < ActiveResouce::Base
    end
  end

Let's say XML contains <book><author><name>John</name></author>....

  Api::Book.first.author.class.to_s #=>
    Ruby 1.8.7: "Api::Book::Author" (namespaced, correct),
    Ruby 1.9: "Author" (toplevel, broken)

Signed-off-by: José Valim <jose.valim@gmail.com>

Rewind to beginning of file before reading from it.

Fixes an issue with Paperclip calling TempFile.read internally just before flushing writes,
resulting in s3_paperclib.rb uploading an empty file.
See http://github.com/thoughtbot/paperclip/commit/2cdeb39a514242df2fdc8a75e193dcecde5a74d5

commit_list.message:
Fix bug where parent node would 'inherit' elements from a child node.

For example when parsing the following XML.

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<post>
  <body>Hello world.</body>
  <replies>
    <post>
      <body>First reply.</body>
    </post>
    <post>
      <body>Second reply.</body>
      <email>2ndreply@example.com</email>
    </post>
  </replies>
</post>

with

class Post
  string :email
end

Would cause Post.parse(doc).email #=> 2ndreply@example.com, because it just uses Nokogiri::XML::Node#at, with an xpath search for 'email'.
This XPath search goes through the whole document. Solution is to limit the search to one node depth maximum.

commit_list.message:
Fix broken module namespacing in ActiveResource with Ruby 1.9 [#5699 state:resolved]

Following namespace use case was broken with Ruby 1.9:

  class Author < ActiveRecord::Base
    ...
  end

  module Api
    class Book < ActiveResouce::Base
    end
  end

Let's say XML contains <book><author><name>John</name></author>....

  Api::Book.first.author.class.to_s #=>
    Ruby 1.8.7: "Api::Book::Author" (namespaced, correct),
    Ruby 1.9: "Author" (toplevel, broken)

Signed-off-by: José Valim <jose.valim@gmail.com>
